pageContext.claim: “And we don't want murderers and drug dealers and gang members, MS-13, and some of the worst people in the world coming into our country. Now, Mexico has had the worst year they've ever had. Almost 40,000 killings in Mexico this year. One of the most unsafe places, unfortunately. We need a wall. And all of the other things are nice to have.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump focuses on the number of murders in Mexico -- it was actually 33,341 in 2018 -- but his comment lacks important context: illegal immigration from Mexico has plummeted in recent years, so for the last ten years it has actually been negative, as more people are going back to Mexico than are entering the United States. MS-13 is not a Mexican gang but originated in Los Angeles, primarily among Salvadorans.
